label: AB3C_hR15_166_bc_dh_ac-001
title: 9R BaRuO$_{3}$ Structure
comments:
BaRuO$_{3}$ is found in four different phases distinguished by the stacking of the ruthenium atoms and their surrounding oxygens (Jin, 2008): \begin{itemize} \item The ground state \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_hR15_166_bc_dh_ac-001}{rhombohedral 9R structure} (this page), \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_hP20_194_ac_f_gh-001}{the hexagonal 4H BaMnO$_{3}$ structure}, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_hP30_194_bf_hk_af-001}{the hexagonal 6H high-temperature BaTiO$_{3}$ structure}, and \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_cP5_221_a_c_b-001}{the cubic perovskite ($E2_{1}$) structure}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 (Jin, 2008) produced the three metastable states by heating the 9R phase to 1000$^\circ$ and subjecting it to pressures of 3\,GPa, 5\,GPa and 18\,GPa, respectively.
